website_summaries.verdict: A compact and effective mini humidifier that's suitable for spaces of up to 220 square feet.
pros: Features a sizable 1.5 liter water tank and removes up to 18 ounces of water per day
Collection tank is easy to empty
The ultra-quiet operation means it won't disturb you as it works

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but Basically Useless
customer_reviews.text: I have TWO AcuRite Pro Indoor humidity monitors in my small 10'x 9' bedroom to measure the change in humidity after running this Pro Breeze Dehumidifier for 4 days straight. Both monitors confirmed that this has only reduced the humidty in my small bedroom by about 2-3%... Really?? That's it after running for 4 straight days nonstop? And it's not really that quiet either. The noise is more than just a "whisper". It's a nice looking product and seems well made and I was excited to get it....but it's basically useless, unless reducing the humidity by 3% makes the quality of ones life any better. Returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Solved window condensation problem
customer_reviews.text: My problem was condensation on the windows. Honestly, I ordered this unit with low expectations based on its size and some of the reviews. I've had it running for three days now and it works perfectly. The picture I attached is after two days and you can see it's about one third full. My windows are dry and my hygrometer indicates the humidity is lower. It runs quietly and apparently is designed to run continuously; the unit stays cool and the wall wort is moderately warm. I had no problem emptying the reservoir. I'm very happy and highly recommend it. If you register your purchase, the manufacturer extends the warranty to two years.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it just under 2 months and it has now started making a loud grinding sound out of nowhere. Nervous to keep it running if it's making a sound like this. Worked well when it was working properly but very disappointed it started doing this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I originally wrote a great 5 star review for this dehumidifier. However I changed my review to just one star because it lasted less than 6 months before breaking. The motor inside just started running very loud and the fan stopped working. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lasted six months of easy use.  Then it became unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier worked really well, until it didn’t. After about six months of use it started making a grinding sound when I turned it on. I’m afraid to try to run it as it could burn up, destroying my camper and the building it is stored in. I don’t know if it is under warranty. I’ll replace it with another brand which costs $30. Many of these brands look identical.
customer_reviews.author: Dan  Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this in a very small and humid bedroom (nursery) for about 3 weeks and it has not collected one drop of moisture! I also have an old fashioned Damp Rid in the room that I purchased for $1. Surprisingly, it DOES work! It looks like I would have been better off using my $50 to buy more of those! Unfortunately I've missed the window to return this product to Amazon or else I would definitely be purchasing something different! I had high hopes for this. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mama

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed. The water only needs to be emptied once a week, and on the 4th time that I emptied it, the little latch inside broke. Now the machine thinks that it is full of water, and therefor won't turn on. Wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: E. Julian

customer_reviews.title: lower your expectations
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply "Made in China". Fan started making awful noise after exactly 1 year. Canister holds less than 2 cups of water, hard to empty, takes days to fill. $50 is a rip-off, worth maybe $20.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hill

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to keep a location, measured at approximately 128 cubic feet, under 55% humidity and it failed to complete the task. I placed it on the ground, halfway up in the area, and even at the ceiling level of the area and got less than an ounce of water after 24 hours in each area and the humidity level stayed above 58% the whole time between 70-78 degrees Fahrenheit. Not worth the purchase. I also purchased the larger version of this (rated for 2200 cubic feet) and got the same results. Neither item is worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a single room
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well. Takes about 1-2 minutes to get to full blowing power but just leaving it my bathroom yielded a surprising amount of water pulled from the air. It's also extremely quiet. I'd recommend leaving the door closed to whatever room you use it in so it doesn't try to pull moist air from outside that room.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ann

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working next day!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great when I used it for the first time in my wardrobe for an hour. It had collected a lot of water in the tank. But, when I emptied the tank and ran it again the next day, the product didn't absorb any moisture and the water tank remained empty. It's now been 3 weeks since the dehumidifier stopped collecting moisture in the water tank. This company should not sell such defective appliances on Amazon anymore. Please spend your $50 elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shruti Garhwal

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly started making loud noises and then quit working after about 5 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: so.... i bought this for my bedroom. i could FEEL the humidity in there. first day i put it on in two hours it sucked up all the humidity out. i use it every day and it works great. it is smaller than it looks (i know i know the dimensions are on there lol but still) for such a tiny thing it works like a monster. I LOVE IT and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: A little bang for a little buck.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this little gizmo because our small bathroom held onto moisture. It’s super simple to set up. You literally just plug it in and flip the switch. It’s extremely quiet. The tank is really easy to empty. I didn’t think it would work that well considering the price and how small it is. I can start to see the tank fill after about 20 minutes of it being on. After five people showering, you can notice a difference in the humidity that would linger in the bathroom. I would recommend this product to anyone with a small bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: mommywhoinks

customer_reviews.title: Not As Energy Saving As I Originally Thought
customer_reviews.text: This one is cheaper to run than the the one I have with a compressor. But if you get up to the amount of airflow and water removal as the one with the compressor. The compressor wins. If it's smaller and does less of course it should save you money. If it did more or the same it would cost more. Research compressor vs desiccant dehumidifier you should be able to find out which device is right for your needs. Unfortunately this is not right for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for a trailer.
customer_reviews.text: While this does work, it doesn’t work well. It’s being used in a travel trailer where the interior is 16ft long. There’s loads of moisture on the windows and in the cupboards but at the pace it’s going it’ll be two weeks before it’s full. The window it’s placed by does clear faster then the others but it is very slow/not powerful enough for this large of a space. 16ft by 8ft with a bed/cupboards filling lots of the space. It is very quiet and a good size.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this unit for about two months and use it on our travel trailer rv. It’s a small trailer, 21 feet interior and is used primarily in our bathroom 24/7 when camping. It hardly moves the air and I can hardly feel the fan drawing in air. I really needed this to work to cut down on humidity in Florida when the trailer was closed up. It will run for two days straight in wet conditions and only a small amount of water accumulates in the full container. I’ll keep looking for a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 months, then started to have burning smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December 2018 because my sunroof leaked, then I used it in a bedroom. It worked well getting humidity out of the room but developed a loud noise which subsided, then a burning smell in April 2019 and seemed to stop dehumidifying. Neither the plug nor the device seemed to be running hot but to be on the safe side I stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: It is really for small spaces eg a small bathroom
customer_reviews.text: It is good for the price and it seems to be working well in my bathroom. Water levels visibly rose during two rainy days with incessant rain and is quiet. I turn it after a shower to take out the moisture and steam. full indicator is working now as is the auto on/off Warranty lasts for 1 year and after that we are on our own. I would like this to last at least 2 years and warranty covering as well. I am thinking of buying another one for the hall bathroom and it should reduce moisture levels to a lot of extent. Good thing going but I see myself replacing one pretty often.
customer_reviews.author: Tommi

customer_reviews.title: A Little Dynamo!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this a little time before writing my review. I was skeptical that something so small could really pull the moisture out of my office room. I was honestly shocked by how quiet it is and how much it could really grab out of the air. I had previously tried those other brands with beads that can spill all over. And, those did work but I wanted something better. I also didn't want to have to continue to buy those products that rid moisture. This mini dehumidifier is really a little dynamo. You can barely hear this little gem working.
customer_reviews.author: kebells

customer_reviews.title: Surely beats Damp Rid!
customer_reviews.text: I don't often rate products because they are not special or above average. I bought one of these dehumidifiers to try out where I have had problems with mildew. I had been using damp rid to resolve the problem. This dehumidifier does the job better, extracting more water from the air than Damp Rid, and without the periodic replacement cost of the Damp Rid. I am now on my third Pro Breeze, one for each closet. The moving part is the fan, which moves the air past the cold side of a Peltier junction, so it is very quiet. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably effective for our RV bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This unit operates 24/7 in our RV shower area. It replaces an identical looking Ivation model (no longer available) that broke after 12+ months continuous use. In comparison, it's definitely whisper quiet and has a much longer power cord which is very convenient. I'm just not sure it's as effective because the water tray collects less than half an inch each day, unlike the old dehumidifier. Not being able to remove the water tray collection lid (both models) is a negative because it gets dusty and moldy inside, even after rinsing it out with bleach from time to time. Hopefully it'll operate for at least a year, or longer, like the Ivation brand did.
customer_reviews.author: miriam r

customer_reviews.title: Great, quiet little workhorse! Quality for your money!
customer_reviews.text: Was having trouble with excess moisture in our single car garage! When it came and I saw how small it was, I thought, "oh no, this will never work!" But to our surprise, this is a wonderful little workhorse! In two or three days time it has a full cup and there is a noticeable difference in our garage! We love it and you barely notice that it is running... very quiet. So glad we bought it! It's very easy to empty! just pull the little black and in seconds it's empty, slide the cup back in, turn it back on and it's ready to go again! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia in FL

customer_reviews.title: Great, quiet dehumidifier for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this little dehumidifier. We have it in a bathroom that does not have a window, and the vent is not very good. We get a good amount of water out of this dehumidifier every day. It does not take up much space, and the noise level is very very minimal. I'm actually thinking of getting this for another one of our bathrooms. I would definitely recommend this for small spaces like a bathroom or closet. They can sit in the corner, completely out of way, and still provide good dehumidifier service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It pulls a cup of water a day!
customer_reviews.text: I make jewelry, so I have quite a bit of metal laying around my work space in my basement. Typical of most basements, mine was always a bit damp, no matter what measures I took to keep it warm and somewhat dry. On the best days I still had to run a heater, just to warm up my space (which is large) and cut down on the dampness. This little dehumidifier, which I run continuously, takes about a cup of water out of the air everyday, which eliminates my need to run a heater and protects all of my metals. Thank you for such a quiet, simple solution!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle M. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Removes moisture very slowly. Expected much more but is better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: This mini dehumidifier is in a small room located in our basement. Other rooms in the basement (only slightly finished) have much larger dehumidifiers but didn’t have a sump pump reservoir to drain water into in the small room so tried this-it collected less than 1ml of water in 4 days in a room starting at 45% humidity. I don’t want to overkill with a large size one and have to carry a heavy container when full of water to another room where I can empty it, so this one is very slowly collecting more water but haven’t come close to having to empty it yet.
customer_reviews.author: LuvAmazon

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a small bedroom that was so ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small bedroom that was so damp there was mold beginning to form on the window blinds and bed frame! Yuck! I was a little skeptical about this because it is small - about the size of a toaster - and I pictured the ones from my parents basement which is the size of a mini- fridge. However, this is quiet and does the job perfectly! It came when promised which was appreciated and has been plugged in since we got it about 3 weeks ago and I WILL NOT be unplugging it!
customer_reviews.author: adira

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good,. but preforms poor in cold weather. Broke after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: This little machine works well enough in our small bathroom, we use it to keep our bathroom from being to steamy or muggy after showers, etc. The machine struggles a bit in winter when temperatures drop considerably but works well the rest of the year. The Pro Breeze does run nearly silent and you'll forget it's even on except for the on light. Mostly good for what I needed and solved a problem at the time, however it broke after 1.5 years so boo!
customer_reviews.author: WASTELAND RAVENTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I’m actually impressed with this little dehumidifier. It’s small, about the size of a small coffee pot. It’s quiet, just a soft humm. And the tray probably holds about 2 cups of water. I bought this for our bathroom, because we’ve been battling some mold. And I needed something inexpensive but effective until we replace our ceiling fan/vent. I’ve noticed a marked difference in the levels of moisture in the past few days. And it’s completely filled up twice in one week! That’s approximately 4 less cups of water in our bathroom air! So far, I’m very happy with the purchase. And I love that it has an automatic shut off when full.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Luca

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Distinct and Noticeable Fan Noises After 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I highly doubt this product would reduce humidity in a 10x10 bedroom. It never removes 9 oz of water per day as it take a whole week to fill up the tank. I have the ideal room temperature for this product to operate. In addition, it was no longer quiet after roughly 90 days. The noise it makes is extremely noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Improvement!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Hawaii, a very humid place. I've never had a dehumidifier, and had several people tell me it would really help. I purchased the Pro Breeze and loved how easy it was to get started. I now have five in the house and can really feel the difference. It's amazing how much impact such a small machine can have. Very pleased, and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Q.

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away! This thing WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how good this dehumidifier works, considering the size. It’s a little powerhouse! I don’t do well with humidity. Especially st night when I’m trying to sleep. Nothing worse than trying to sleep in sweaty sheets! So I decided to try a dehumidifier. I read the reviews and they were all really good, so I thought I’d give it a shot. Since it was much smaller (and less expensive) I didn’t expect much. Boy was I surprised! It is amazing! I HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone trying to get rid of excess humidity in a bedroom, or s basement. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M Burbank

customer_reviews.title: Works okay if you understand its limitations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to dehumidify one bathroom in the house that tends to have higher humidity that often leads to musty odors. So far this product has worked ok with the pros and cons; Pros: It has removed much of the musty odors from the bathroom. It is small and fits on the bathroom vanity. Cons: It can only handle dehumidifying a very SMALL area. Do not buy this product to remove humidity in large spaces or in multiple rooms. This is a Thermoelectric (aka Peltier heat pump) humidifier is NOT a condenser type dehumidifier that one would have in their damp basement, so water collection is very slow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Petite and quiet, it works perfectly in my closet and bathroom. Since using the unit, the musty/mildewy smell that used to plague my clothing and towels is gone. The unit is very easy to set-up and fairly easy to empty (the emptying process could use some updates; it’s easy, but you’ll need to wipe the storage container down before re-inserting and it can be a little messy). When full (in my little Florida apartment, 1-2 times per week) it automatically stops running and a yellow indicator light turns on. I can’t speak to energy efficiency too much, but did not see an obvious change in my utilities bill. Overall, I’m a happy camper and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really love this dehumidifier! It works great for my little apartment, the dehumidifier really pulls all of the extra moisture out of the air like a charm and it’s so quiet! It’s really easy to work as well, to dump the excess water you just turn it off and pull it out and there’s a little plug that you pop off and then drain it. So pleased with my purchase and I’ve had it a month, I would definately recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: I looked through like 17 different dehumidifiers the day I bought this one. Those 1-2 star reviews were holding me back! My room is pretty big (11x14) so the size of it had me worried it wouldn’t work. I wanted something that would help with the window condensation, and to somehow help with my pillows that lay against the wall to stop feeling almost humid-like in the mornings?? It really surprised me.. in only 12 hours (7pm-7am) it had collected about half an inch!? (1st pic) The window was dry!!!! Amazing!! I only really use it at night.. 3days later, it was halfway full (2nd pic)! It’s easy to use and easy to empty!
customer_reviews.author: Elenaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Pro Breeze Mini
customer_reviews.text: First of all I like the design of the Mini Dehumidifier . It is a look-a-like and replaces a very similar one which I loved and used non stop for 5 years until it died . It did a great job , had double capacity of the new 1200 sq ft one . I have tried The Pro Breeze Mini several times for about 48 hrs at a time and found only drops of water in the tank . So I have stopped using it at all . Maybe the Mini is only good for a damp closet and not effective in a small room . I am very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Keeley

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I should say I am in the process of returning the dehumidifier and that the process has gone well so far.That being said when the product arrived i was rather skeptical as it was so small, I quickly found out that it could not perform in three different locations, firstly a damp car , then a garage and finally a humid bathroom. In all 3 cases it did nothing. I would recommend for others to look at larger dehumidifiers that can deal with larger areas .
customer_reviews.author: Ian H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: The item did not work at all. I put it in our camper van overnight hoping to get rid of the humidity. I also placed a humidity gauge next to it. I came out the next morning expecting the small tank to be full and the humidity down. There was, probably, less than half a cup of water in the holding tank and the humidity actually increased. So no. I absolutely do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ugruk

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret buying this product.
customer_reviews.text: Our bedroom is in the basement and we started noticing behind our furniture there was mold growing... so needless to say a dehumidifier was needed. Signed on Amazon that night, found this little guy and two days later we plugged it in. It has been about two weeks since we've had it and I have not one complaint. Its small enough to sit on our bedside table, its quiet and it DOES ITS JOB! We've emptied the container about 3 times with no issues. Easy, cheap and makes the air clear!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby G.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a long time ago for a very small space. Didn't make a single difference how long it had been running--humidity level never changed. Slow to collect condensation, and for some reason (yes, after reading instructions) taking the pool of water out was NOT easy. The tray would always always always get stuck. Dissatisfied customer and ended up throwing it away after five months of attempted use.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie McGehee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Our Bathroom!
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny machine. I bought it for my bathroom. It has no window, but it does have a top of the line vent fan in the shower area. The fan just isn't enough. I put the dehumidifier behind the toilet, run it 24/7 and it is wonderful! It has a tiny water capture tank, so do not buy this for a large room. It is perfect for the bathroom. It is easy to drain and just leaves me wondering why it took me so long to purchase something so reasonably priced that makes such a difference in our home. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for my needs. I have a bathroom with a humidity problem, and I hate letting the bathroom fan run all day long to combat the problem. I had ordered a different humidifier, but it died after a couple of months. That's when I saw this little guy! It pulls the humidity from my bathroom nicely, but the feature I really like is the mechanical on/off switch. This allows me to plug it into a smart plug, and turn it on with either my phone or Alexa. It also allows me to set it up to turn off after a certain amount of time, so it doesn't run more than I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Koolaid

customer_reviews.title: The "Pro Breeze Electric..." does NOT remove water
customer_reviews.text: The company notified me by email AFTER the item was delivered that there could be a defect as stated by previous buyers. It does NOT remove water from small areas in the apartment. It just runs doing NOTHING!!!! I should be getting a FULL REFUND. This is a case of fraud. The item should NOT be on the market at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine D Blount

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing but not by much
customer_reviews.text: I've had it running non stop for 3 months in by bathroom. It takes about a week to collect less than a quarter cup of water. No matter how humid it gets not once has it even gotten near half full, EVER. This is at temperatures of 70's to mid 80's. The water evaporates almost as quickly as it's collected. Almost zero air flow can be detected from the unit. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Day

customer_reviews.title: The Best Purchase for My Boat!
customer_reviews.text: Living on a small antique sail boat is my dream come true. While living in a tiny floating home has many advantages, the are some... issues. Not least of which is moisture. Without a modern HVAC system, moisture builds up resulting in mildew and mold. In the week I've had this tiny dehumidifier, mildew growth has basically slowed to a crawl. Nothing... I repeat NOTHING can stop nature from being nature but, this simple device really packs a punch in the battle! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Haverly

customer_reviews.title: This a really small unit for very small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 but I am returning the one I have not opened. It is too small for my use. It works as advertised and arrived as promised but it is too small for my needs. Since I opened the one I will keep it but have to return the second and seek a larger capacity unit for my larger needs This is not a negative review just disappointed it did not have the larger capacity. BIG NOTE for the readers......The unit WILL work without the basin inserted. I placed mine on a board over a sink and the water drains into the sink in the head (potty) on my boat and down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Ragbagr

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces!
customer_reviews.text: We have a poorly designed apartment when no cent in the master bathroom and have had issues with condensation and mold as a result. After the most recent clean up, we have been keeping this little sucker in the bathroom with the door shut and small window open after showers. It’s truly shocking how much water it takes in, and we have noticed the bathroom door isn’t swelling anymore. So, only time will tell, but it seems to really help.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hammerschlag

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet and it's small, I'll say that for it. Easy to operate and not unattractive. But I"m running it inside a grow tent where the RH is in the mid to high 50% range. I want it under 50% and this unit can't seem to do it. After 3 days running 24/7, it collects about a tablespoon of water. RH reduction is minimal if any at all. I can not imagine how this unit would dehumidify a steamy bathroom if it can't do the job in a 3x5x6 grow tent. I have to wonder if my unit is defective or if the reviews are. So it's gotta go back.
customer_reviews.author: JBN

customer_reviews.title: Small but effective
customer_reviews.text: Okay so if you're looking for this to do an entire floor of your home or anything more than a small room, your obviously didnt read the description. I am a sneaker collector and my collection must remain under a certain humidity to prevent fungus and mold and deterioration. I just moved and my sneaker room was consistently 70% humidity. I got this and its now down to 50%. Its not the best but if you're looking for this little thing to bring you from 70% to 20% in a 12x16 room... you have another thing coming. For this price this does exactly as intended.
customer_reviews.author: DerekJ

customer_reviews.title: Good, but will fail in time in approximately 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. The first one failed after just under 2 years due to the cheap power supply. Cheap capacitors in the power adapter leak and fail in time (a common problem). I was able to replace them myself and now have a backup unit running, but the fan is starting to get noisier. The thermoelectric cooler still works, so I have been able to extend its life a bit. All in all a good design.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: When things get sticky, you can trust Pro Breeze!
customer_reviews.text: I'd noticed mild black mold on the walls of my spare bedroom, but the final straw was when I found traces of mold on a few of my DVD/Blu-ray cases (located on shelves close to the window/walls). With zero experience with dehumidifiers, I began doing a little research and settled on this Pro Breeze Mini Dehumidifier based on the size and price (opting to add on the ridiculously cheap four-year extended warranty). The unit was shockingly easy to set up and has worked wonders, so far. It took about five days for the water tray to fill up which proves moisture was definitely an issue in this particular case. Highly recommended for smaller spaces!
customer_reviews.author: Brett Warwick

customer_reviews.title: Fourth product from this company, first of the small model.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth product I have bought from this company, but the first of the smallest model. It is in our bedroom, on the dresser with a TV. It is very quiet, it is not hard to sleep through the noise it makes, it's only deficiency is that the on light is a little bit bright and if you are in a direct line of sight it will shine in your eyes. In one day at removed exactly the amount of water out of the air as it should. This company makes very good products and I have been very satisfied this far.
customer_reviews.author: sarahmama2ev

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for my Class B Motor Home
customer_reviews.text: While my Roadtrek sits idle in the hot humid Florida summer, I wanted a solution to control the humidity inside. This tiny quiet little machine was a perfect solution to that problem. My only issue was I didn't want to have to drain it every couple of days. So after reading another review about adding a drain hose, I did that and now its perfect. I used a 1/4 npt hose nipple, a step bit, and some waterproof sealant. I added a hose to the nipple and put it into the sink, now It empties itself.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pires

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my RV, cold weather camping. Anyone that runs the furnace in their RV knows how much condensate gets created. It doesn't work super fast but it does pull moisture out of the air. It is compact, quiet and inexpensive. No complaints here. I imagine this would work great in a bathroom as well. It says it can cover a 1000 sq foot area. I don't think there is any way this could keep up with the large dehumidifier we use in our basement. However, given the size, noise level and price I wouldn't expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works well in small bedroom!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this dehumidifer about a month ago for one of our bedrooms that just always felt damp (wood floors felt sticky, etc.). We run it almost 24 hours a day and the water it pulls out of the air is amazing. We were previously using things like DampRid, etc. and still have those in the room, but each day the water tank of the dehumidifer has a significant amount of water in it AND most importantly, the room is not so damp anymore! On top of that, you really can't hear the dehumidifer. So, works great for us! Thinking about getting another for a different room...we will see!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: This unit is claimed to remove up to 9oz of water from the air each day, when in reality it is closer to 1oz or maybe 2oz. It is supposed to work well at managing humidity levels in a space of up to 1200 sq ft. I purchased this unit with a hydrometer to measure the impact on overall humidity. This unit has no affect on the overall humidity in my 950 sq ft home. I even kept my bedroom door closed most of the time to see if the unit could perform more effectively in smaller spaces, and the unit still proved to be ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: William Jones

customer_reviews.title: Defintely pulls the humidity (water) out of a small room.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my concrete basement "walk-in safe". The safe is about 7'x5' and 7' tall. The dehumidifier is working well to controll the humidity in the safe, down to 46%. It does have some fan noise, therefore I would not want this in a room where I was sitting. The unit is ver small as is the collection chamber. Therefore I cannot imagine it could control the humidity in room larger the a small bedroom. It does work well in small space fro sure. Works perfect for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan R.

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my bathroom which does not have ventilation. This has been amazing and has really helped with the humidity. At first I didn't think it would do much but it really does collect quite a bit of water. I turn it on after my shower and leave it running till morning. Now I will say, sometimes in the morning when I go to plug it out it is warm so I definitely would not leave this plugged in all day. The only thing I would change would be the color to make it blend in a little more but considering the price, size and power- I would 100% buy again and have recommended it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Labrada

customer_reviews.title: Best dehumidifier, period...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing and super reliable. And for the cost, you can't go wrong. I've used this non stop since I bought it in March of 19. It is now the end of January 20 and it is still working like the day I recieved it. Seriously, I have it on 24/7. All functions continue to work and it is super quiet. If I ever need another dehumidifier, this is the one I will get. And no, I was not party of any promotion and I'll only give honest reviews on purchases I feel inspired to.
customer_reviews.author: MtnManSam

customer_reviews.title: How much square footage the unit covers before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: Well my husband ordered this but did not read the details. Our bedroom was too big a space to use it in so we decided to put in the bathroom. It works extremely well in that smaller space and keeps the humidity out. We may purchase a bigger model for our apartment at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: During the summer months our condo guest bathroom became very humid (especially with having the washer and dryer housed within the bathroom) which contributed to an unfortunate growth of mold. This little diddy did a fantastic job decreasing the humidity, contributed to ceased mold growth, and was easy to manage as it really only needed to be emptied every three days (although I'm still impressed at how much moisture it was pulling from the air). I really enjoy the auto-shutoff when full feature and its very quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Maples

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Keep in mind that it is meant for very small spaces — like closets or very small rooms. Definitely not meant for big rooms. I read a few complaints about the noise, which I find confusing-- either these people were sleeping on top of the machine or they had it in front of a sound-amplifying device. I have hyper-sensitive ears and I think it's incredibly quiet. A lot of the issues in other reviews seem to happen after 6 months, so we'll see of there's an update then.
customer_reviews.author: F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: The little humidifier that could
customer_reviews.text: We have a bathroom in our basement that always gets a musty, earthy smell when the season turns (i.e. when it's damper outside), and this little humidifier has really helped us combat that. We've kept it running constantly for about a month now with no signs of diminished performance. I would just warn people that you can't clean the collection tray. There's only a small plug that you can remove to empty out the water. I mean, it's not a big deal because the water is basically distilled so there's nothing to clean - just be careful not to lose/pour anything in the well because it's not coming back out.
customer_reviews.author: KyraTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use this dehumidifier to keep moisture out of a small bathroom in an old house. The original owners of the house who built it did not put a fan in the bathroom, so over the years mold has been a recurring issue. After cleaning the bathroom top to bottom with bleach, I put this little dehumidifier in the bathroom and it sits on top of my toilet. So far it is doing great! It is so quiet and it gets so much water out of our bathroom. After a while, dust accumulates, but I just take a q-tip to the vents. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: What Disapointment
customer_reviews.text: I have a small music room. In which are acoustic guitars. It is imperative the humdiy be kept at a certain range It is 9' x 8' with seven foot ceiling. So that is 72 sq ft and 504 cubic ft. It's like it's not even on, and the humdiy just keeps rising. It doesn't have any control other than off and on. I am sending it back. SAVE YO MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I waited few months after I used the dehumidifier to post my review. I use it for a small bedroom where there is no AC. Summer time can get very humid and the fan alone is not comforting at night. I leave the dehumidifier on all day and night. I also use a fan to circulate the air and I felt the difference few days after I started the use of the dehumidifier. The tray that holds the water get full about every 3 days and the auto shut off works every time when the tray gets full. The noise level is very minimial. No louder than a quiet fan. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Arbil

customer_reviews.title: Catboy is Cooler and Comfier
customer_reviews.text: AAAAIIIIRRRRR! It is terribly hot and humid out here (the kind of hot where you sweat all day and stick to everything), but these tiny little machine (which is smaller than a toaster) helps suck the hot humidity away, making it feel so much cooler and less 'sticky' inside the house. It doesn't seem to be making any noise, nor does it seem to bother any pets. It works pretty well, easy to use, easy to empty. Already recommended this product a lot and considered buying a second one for the bathroom. 5/5 Stars AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Meowstopheles

customer_reviews.title: For small closed areas-Exc. Customer support
customer_reviews.text: No frills efficient dehumidifier for a very small room. It does move water out of the air without killing your electric bill but it does it very slowly. 70 degree 50-60% humidity levels take only a couple ounces in a couple days. No appreciable change when monitoring with a humidity meter in the room but you do empty water out of the tray in a week, just not much. Customer Service is very high as I had reason to write them and they were prompt and professional in handling the issue.
customer_reviews.author: JWhite

customer_reviews.title: Great dehumidifier!!
customer_reviews.text: It has been about a month and this thing is very impressive. I use it in my bedroom and with tile floor that was built on a former garage so the floor does not have insulation. So when temperature changes I get damp floors. But with this dehumidifier that does not happen. Very impressive. And leaving it on for a week I got a full container of water and then the second week just about a half or a quarter container of water. And this is in Mississippi so you know we have humid air. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is a work horse!
customer_reviews.text: I had heavy condensation on my ceiling register in my bathroom. I was tired of wiping the floor every morning. I ordered this dehumidifier, after ready the reviews. I am so glad I did. After the first night - no more condensation. And the dehumidifier had about 1/2 inch of water in it. It's been on for almost a week now, and almost full. It's amazing how much water it takes our of the air. It's very, very quiet and the light works as a nightlight. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: beth  stanton

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first but didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great at first and pulled a bunch of water from the air. I bought it in November 2016 as of the end of April 2017 it has burned out and no longer works. It now makes a super loud sound and no longer pulls water.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to get a dehumidifier that was small but efficient in my bathroom since I live in a house that doesn't have a venting fan. I was using a much larger dehumidifier and wanted something more portable. This unit simply could not keep ahead of the moisture in the bathroom when someone was taking a shower, and even afterwards was struggling. I returned it and will continue to look for something smaller than a 30 pint that will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: carefulconsumer

customer_reviews.title: where often the surrounding temperature is comfortable when the humidity is low
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this humidifier for our 14 x 14 Eze-breeze enclosed porch. We used it successfully before the split system Mitsubishi HVAC unit was added. We live in the South, where often the surrounding temperature is comfortable when the humidity is low. We continue to use this quiet little unit as an adjucnt to our HVAC unit. Frequently between the Pro Breeze Mini and the overhead fan, we are comfortable without turning on the AC. A good little purchase; small, effective, and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Barb

customer_reviews.title: Product works, is small, and silent!
customer_reviews.text: Using the dehumidifier in our summer cabin bedroom that doesn't have AC or a dehumidifier system is perfect; easy to use, it sucks lots of water out of the air riding the smell of mildew. It is small, easy to use,and silent, a real plus in a bedroom. Perfect during humid weather!
customer_reviews.author: A. Heyl

customer_reviews.title: Whisper quiet and makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the South, where the enemy of Summer heat is the humidity with heat indices around 115 degrees. The longer it runs, the more efficient it becomes, filling to capacity every two days. It has reduced my use of an extra fan at night and made daytime temps more comfortable without increasing the use of the A/C for the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Pretty... pretty... pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little dehumidifier. It started working right away in my small windowless bathroom. It definitely feels drier. My only gripes are that I wish there was a humidity gauge on it and that it had a litttttle more oomph. I may be comparing it unfairly to the honking one we have for our basement that seems to suck the moisture out instantly, but this little guy feels a little underpowered. I definitely need to run it for longer. It was the best rated on amazon for its size, so the others must really stink.
customer_reviews.author: Megs Benedict

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after less than a year's use
customer_reviews.text: I got this dehumidifier for my bedroom, which gets very humid during the rainy PNW winter; mold was growing on my window sills. Though small, the Pro Breeze was doing a good job keeping the mold at bay, but it has recently stopped working. I purchased this unit in December of 2016, and hoped that for the price it would last at least a couple of years! Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Varvara

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine for a small room. Our 1,300 cu ft bedroom had moisture buildup on the windows in cold weather, leading to mold and mildew along the sills. This really quiet running machine does the trick. No more moisture problem. Has survived a couple of hard falls when re-arranging room - solid construction. Not sure if there's an easier way to empty the container. Would be great if white top came off for easy dumping. Can't figure out how, but will drain out the hole in the top.
customer_reviews.author: greenearth_octobersky

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dehumidifier to replace another older compact model that stopped working. This model is smaller in size but has a similar sized catch basin. The fan is a bit louder on this model but still very, very quiet. It also seems to collect more water from the air than the older model. For reference, the dehumidifier is being used in my 56 sq ft windowless bathroom. Living in New England without air conditioning, the room can get very damp and stuffy. This little gadget helps significantly and so far I am very pleased with the product. As a bonus, the seller shipped quickly and let me know they'd be available for questions or concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about this unit. Small, compact, quiet. I have a garage full of classic Harleys and want to regulate the humidity as best I can, this unit is a big part of that. My garage is larger than a normal two car so I just ordered a second unit which will do the job perfectly. Fast shipping, easy to operate, easy to drain, auto shut off when full is an awesome feature. Great customer service if needed. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MF Baja

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't do the job
customer_reviews.text: The product did not reduce the humidity in a 120 sq foot room even a little. It took a week to fill it's little tank once. The humidity varied between 76% and 63% during the test time. The room is air conditioned and closed to the outside. The AC system doesn't reduce the humidity much on its lowest fan setting on which I usually run it. So I bought this to help. It didn't help. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Randen L. Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has these in her basement and they work extremely well. I built a meat curing chamber and needed to control humidity. The unit is small, takes up very little room and works well in the confined space. I would definitely suggest this product for spaces less then 200 square feet.
customer_reviews.author: TLV

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little dehumidifier. We use it in the bathroom of our apartment since we have no fan. Our bathroom was often much too moist from our daily showers and the humidity of the environment, so our towels barely dried each day and a lot of mold was growing in and around our shower. We now turn the dehumidifier on when we take a shower at night and turn it off in the morning. It's done a tremendous job of decreasing the humidity of our bathroom and preventing the growth of mold! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It works better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller than I thought it would be. It works far better than I anticipated. It's very quiet, very effective. It's been a few days, there's water to be emptied, I'm sleeping much better. It's well worth the money. It's in my bedroom now, I'll get one for my van. ~~ I've had this for a while. I love it. It's quiet, it's so effective. The change in my room is wonderful! The humidity isn't a bother anymore!
customer_reviews.author: janacoyote

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised with this little dehumidifier. We bought it for our master bathroom and due to the outlets we really needed it to fit on the double vanity space. I was worried it wouldn’t, but it is so small it fit great! Just what we needed. The noise is not bad at all and I’m very sensitive to sounds. It’s extremely easy to operate and you can easily see how full of water it is. I’m very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJM

customer_reviews.title: It works...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it in my bedroom for nearly two weeks and so far I've emptied it twice and now it's nearly half full again. Clearly it works. However, some days my small bedroom is still a little damp and musty, so it doesn't completely fix the problem, but does improve it a lot. The first day using it I especially noticed a difference. I wouldn't expect miracles from this product in a really damp space, but it is helpful and I'm glad I purchased it. Maybe I'll get a second one to run on the opposite end of the room, eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Django

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Old, Basement Apartment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after noticing the airflow in the apartment I moved into was lackluster. It is a basement apartment in a 1920's duplex in the South. The humidity is no joke down here and it's not something you want inside your home. I ordered two of these to take care of the front + back room which have no air vents. These little things are quiet, and I've noticed the difference in the air *immediately*. The dehumidifier is so easy to empty as well. Since purchasing about two weeks ago, my towels dry more quickly, and my furniture no longer feels damp. So glad I purchased these. Can't imagine how I lived without them before!!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: I've waited about two weeks to write this review hoping there would be a change. The dehumidifier was placed in a room around 250 sq ft and it has maybe collected 1/8 of the water in the room. We have a humidifier reader in the room to monitor when it gets too high. This product has not helped to lower the humidity in the room more than a degree or so. I am rather disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Working Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Need a room sized unit for a bathroom/laundry room combination in Florida. This one works quickly and is very easy to empty and operate. I just hope it lasts longer than the 6 months I got out of the last one I bought--NOT this model, an unrelated one.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mom

customer_reviews.title: With modification this is great dehumidifier in a motor home in storage
customer_reviews.text: I use this to dehumidify my motor home. I keep 120 volt power to motor home and use this with small modification. So I don't have to go to storage and empty water receptacle I drilled a small hole about 1/2 way up, then glued small tubing (aquarium air pump tube) into the hole. The other end of tube is then inserted in sink. This allows the unit to work all the time and the moisture it collects simply flows down the sink drain to gray water tank. This is my third unit, it lasts about one year in constant operation, so I replace annually. Much better than the dry granules, those leave residue on surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet. Effective
customer_reviews.text: Runs very quiet. Does the job. I LOVE this thing!!!!! It does a great job of pulling moisture out of the air. I use the collected water for my plants - they seem to like it. Have been using it nonstop and did I say, I Love this thing!! Purchased in the HEAT of August, and I noticed that I was much more comfortable in the living room/kitchen area. I am impressed. I also noticed that I complained about the heat much less, cause I was more COMFORTABLE!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: VERY small
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it said it was for basements. I should have read a little more. This unit is VERY small. They are quite misleading. Definitly not size appropriate for basements at all. It is quiet and does it's job, but just not for basements. Not household basements. READ ALL INFORMATION THOROUGHLY BEFORE YOU BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: PCC

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well in high traffic areas.
customer_reviews.text: This is made for small rooms that get very little use. I had it in an office that, while smaller than the recommended size, had people going in and out of throughout the day. With the door closed the door and left overnight it collected a small amount of water but opening the door completely undid any drying that happened. I think this would be good for a small closet or room that sees little use. I would not recommend this for any place that needs to be dried out that is used frequently.
customer_reviews.author: B Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Small and effective room dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier was to supplement the new wall AC units my mid century high rise requires- the new Freon-free don’t dry the humid air the way the older ones did. This small unit makes it less sticky for sleeping. About the size of an electric can opener, it generates just a soft hiss. I empty it about every 2 or 3 days and per the seller shake the reservoir with detergent monthly to prevent mildew.
customer_reviews.author: disco75

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Little Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: His device works great. It is however very important to understand that this is a very small unit. I am using it in a small bedroom sized studio apartment and for this it works well. Depending on humidity I've seen the tank average between 1/4 to half full in one day. It is small, very quiet, visually appealing and seems to be a well designed dehumidifier that's extremely easy to set up and use but keep in mind that it is very small and would likely not work well in a garage or large space. For my purposes, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and small. Great for closets.
customer_reviews.text: This is very small so it will work great for closets. Not good for a room, but would keep your clothes dry on a humid day. I have to emty it every couple days, as I live in a humid area. Very quiet and small. Cons: Not for drying spills or leaking areas. Only good for extremely small spaces. Conclusion: Knowing what I said above, good for what it is designed to do, and perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It's small quiet and works great. I bought this for our pantry which is a non working 9x12 walkin freezer. Humidity was 70% . After I put this in on the floor next to the door the humidity after 3 days has dropped to just above 50%, which is in the acceptable range according to the hydrometer. I moved it to a rear corner and have not check it yet. I'm hopping to get the humidity down a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: This thing really carries its weight and then some! Been using it to dehumidify my bathroom which has poor setup for circulation, no fan, and the window out is very tiny. Haven't worried much about mold since. One day we had a major water spill on our carpet- soaked an entire section away from the sun and couldn't dry it out! Sat our dehumidifier right next to the spill for a few days and it sucked up ALL the moisture and got the carpet back to normal dryness!
customer_reviews.author: iJone

customer_reviews.title: Functions but....LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product does pull moisture for the air, easy operation, and easy to clean..... but this is one loud lil unit. I have it in RV bedroom and you can hear it from livingroom.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

product_meta.title: Pro Breeze Electric Mini Dehumidifier, 1200 Cubic Feet (150 sq ft), Compact and Portable for High Humidity in Home, Kitchen, Bedroom, Bathroom, Basement, Caravan, Office, RV, Garage with Auto Shut Off
feature_bullets: SMALL & COMPACT: Lightweight, Compact and Portable, Capable of removing up to 9 ounces of water per day with a 16-ounce water tank capacity. Ideal for rooms up to 1200 cubic feet (150 sq ft).

AUTO SHUT OFF: When full the dehumidifier will automatically shut off and the LED light will turn-on indicating the water tank needs draining. Simply empty the water tank and place it back into the dehumidifier.
ULTRA-QUIET & ENERGY EFFICIENT: Whisper quiet operation in bedrooms, bathrooms and offices, at an output of 23W per hour, which means only using 0.55kW after running for 24 hours.
REMOVES 9 OUNCES OF WATER/DAY: Optimal function in room sizes up to 1200 cubic feet (150 sq ft).

LOWERS HUMIDITY: Perfect for high humidity in your home, kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, caravan, garage, closet. Like all mini dehumidifiers, optimal operating temperature is 59-86°F. It will not work below 41°F.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars10,366 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: Pro breeze offer a full 12 month warranty. If you have any questions please contact our friendly customer service team who will be happy to help.
